title: MSW Medical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ballad Health (Johnson City, TN) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was incredible. The managers who interviewed me were outstanding, and the peer interview with the social work team was great even though I dreaded it! They make a great team and I'm disappointed HR couldn't meet my salary requests.
Interview Questions: Do you consider yourself an optimistic person or a pessimistic person?

title: Registered Nurse - Operating Room Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ballad Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received a call from the operating room manager. Spoke to the operating room manager for a face to face interview. Was told during interview I received the position.
Interview Questions: Experience in the operating room.

title: Population Data Analyst (FT) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Ballad Health in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: I applied in December of 2022. A month later, in early January, I was contacted by a recruiter, and an interview was scheduled over Zoom with two supervisors that next week. In the interview, they were nice and easygoing. They said and reassured me that I was a great candidate, only to ghost me after the interview, which I believe is very unprofessional of them.
Interview Questions: Describe a project you worked on, highlighting the steps of the data analysis process and how you addressed them.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ballad Health in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Very well organized, and I am fully involved in every step. Once they find the right candidate, they mover forwards very fast, and I am able to negotiate the compensation package.
Interview Questions: Technical questions, referenced by resume, I guess it depends on the jobs.

title: Nurse Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Ballad Health (Kingsport, TN) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: When I interviewed with Ballad, I was only asked my availability and start date. No questions about experience or qualifications were asked. I wouldn't even really call it an interview.
Interview Questions: When are you able to start?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ballad Health (Kingsport, TN) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Hiring event, quick interview but did not work out as expected due to the conflict of what was said from the interview and what was said during the period of giving the offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and experience?

title: Certified Surgical Technologist (CST) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ballad Health (Kingsport, TN) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Have only completed a phone interview at this time.  I'm waiting to see if I am selected to do an in person interview. Have a phone interview scheduled with another facility. I am also applying at another location.
Interview Questions: Asked what shift I was interested in

title: Data Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Ballad Health
Interview Descriptions: My interview was very chaotic and not particularly timely, but at the same time it was kind and supportive. I would say that it was not terribly professional, but not the worst I've ever had, either
Interview Questions: SQL homework, logic questions, personality questions

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ballad Health (Johnson City, TN) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy and not much of a follow up regarding applications unless you check your portal online but the process went well. Also worth noting that hiring managers do not know the pay.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite marketing tactic?

title: PCT/CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ballad Health
Interview Descriptions: Very easy! The manager was extremely nice and answered all my questions. It was a easy process to do. They didn’t ask many questions, they just wanted to know my availability for the week and my goals in 5 years.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Health Referral Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ballad Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy and the interviewing manager was laid back and made you feel comfortable. Questions based on previous work experience and education. No difficult questions or questions that are meant to confuse.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you have a difficult customer and how you handled the call?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Ballad Health
Interview Descriptions: Smooth, quick, and easy. Show excitement for the job and being an engaged learner. Well rounded computer skills are crucial! Knowledge with radio systems and healthcare terminology or background helps tremendously for faster on the job training.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ballad Health
Interview Descriptions: i was very pleased with the process once you applied. The search feature and application process is a bit cumbersome, but once submitted the process is very transparent. Once I submitted, I was able to see the steps for my application (under review, interview scheduled,etc.)
Interview Questions:
Asked about the job and what they were looking for in an employee
Was asked basic interview questions

title: Labor Management Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ballad Health
Interview Descriptions: There was a team Interview - Round Table Questions. There was time to answer and ask questions as needed. Friendly team. Not a bad experience at all. Business like but not too serious. Sort of casual.
Interview Questions: There were quite a few questions. I cannot narrow it down to one or two. Mostly common interview type questions. Experience, tools used, etc type ?s

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ballad Health (Norton, VA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Went for second interview Wednesday and still waiting, made the top 2 which is great but so badly want the job. Praying I get it. Manager was so nice a d we just clicked from the start.
Interview Questions: Work experience and why I want to leave my current position

title: IT Clinical Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ballad Health
Interview Descriptions:
An initial screening interview was scheduled and  was followed by an online assessment that is a predictor of success with required Epic software certification. 
The final interview was with a manager and a director.
Interview Questions: The final interview was comprised of roughly 10 questions during a 45 minute window.

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ballad Health
Interview Descriptions: It was really just me going in and talking to several of the people. I had to wear a mask due to Covid. It was really hot in the building. I was sweating. I don’t think this was a good setup.
Interview Questions: They asked me if I was looking at anyone else

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ballad Health
Interview Descriptions: I was given a call by a unit manager after submitting an questionnaire on a search engine. After speaking with the unit manager I was given a call by a representative to schedule an appointment to complete a health assessment.
Interview Questions: Generic questions included why I chose this corporation, long-term goals, etc.

title: Digital Content Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Ballad Health (Johnson City, TN) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: The woman was totally rude and asked inappropriate questions that are against federal laws such as when did I graduate, marital status, whether my gender could do this job and if I take prescription drugs.
Interview Questions: The interviewer asked my age along with other inappropriate questions.

title: Outpatient Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ballad Health (Kingsport, TN) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: One interview was required. She asked me to talk about myself and then she described the job duties. When I was leaving she informed me that they were looking for someone to fulfill the position immediately.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: PCP Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Ballad Health
Interview Descriptions: Met with manager. I was in nursing school. Asked availability, etc. Not difficult at that time, but I'm sure its changed. Not much else to say about interview because it's been over 20 years.
Interview Questions: When are you available?

title: Business Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Ballad Health (Kingsport, TN) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Had to submit to a personality quiz prior to interview. Initial phone interview with department manager.  on site interview with manager, team,  department head.  Interviewers were very personable and accommodating.  The team panel interview was informative and congenial.  Although I was informed they'd make a decision within a week, it was around one month later when I received the rejection email.  I had accepted another position by that time.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you had to work with others who were experiencing morale issues.  How did you deal with these issues and getting the job done ?

title: Neurosurgery Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ballad Health (Johnson City, TN) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 groups to meet (one in kingsport and one in Johnson City). Very nice groups and friendly.   I don't think they were prepared for an interviewee. There is some miscommunication between the groups and Ballad health.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to choose neurosurgery?

title: X-Ray Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ballad Health (Kingsport, TN) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was a student and interviewed for a student tech position so the interview was semi professional and not as stressful as if I were interviewing as an already registered technologist. When I became registered my title just changed.
Interview Questions: What makes you an asset to this hospital?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Ballad Health (Kingsport, TN) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Pretty cut and dry. Quick interview with manager. Generic questions about stress and customer service. Business casual dress for interview. Manager was very nice and asked if I had any questions at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: How do you handle an upset customer?

title: Ekg Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ballad Health
Interview Descriptions: It took a while to hear from someone after i replied. nice people and simple questions. HR called to set up the interview and i went for the interview the next day. Waited a few days for them to call back and offer the job.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in this job opportunity

title: Core Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Ballad Health (Johnson City, TN) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: First interview with the hiring manager. Then had a second interview where I met many of the team members I would be working with, after that I had an interview with two VPs. Then I gave a 10 minute presentation that I had previously prepared. After that interview I got an offer from the company.
Interview Questions: How do you handle people who are reluctant to accept change or new methods of doing something?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Ballad Health (Houston, TX) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview process went really well. Asked questions such as what are you strengths and weaknesses, how soon will you be able to start working, etc. Interview lasted around 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Describe a work conflict and how you resolved it.

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Ballad Health
Interview Descriptions: The management when I was employed there were horrible! They have changed now which I know is excellent for them because now they have a manager that doesn't look down on people
Interview Questions: Can you work whenever we schedule
